body:
Hi,

Thanks for the report. I'm going to close this as it's formulated as a bug report on the lack of popup explanatory text on the button, but we don't have any popups on *any* buttons in the UI and I'm not convinced that we should, either. Rather, the buttons should be self explanatory.

It might be legitimate to retitle the button if it causes confusion or looks scary. Generally speaking all buttons with scary actions are scary-colored.

Perhaps we could retitle this button to "Show Change Log" to make it clearer what it does.

In the meantime, please don't be afraid to press it.
Actually, lets retain and make this actionable.

rename.from: Explanatory text / link for GUI "Global Changes" button
rename.to: "Global Changes" button is confusing. Retitle to "Show Change Log"?

issue.title: Global changes button

issue.body: The string for this new button isn't available for translation in Transifex

body:
Hm. Being a developer, I’d expect to see the _software’s change log_ when activating a link/button that’s labelled »Change log«, so I’d rather _not_ call it that. The icon looks scary to me, kinda »Undo« or »Rollback« something.

Since it shows _some_ of the latest changes only, why not use an »info« icon like U+1F6C8 (letter »i« in a circle) and label it something like »Latest actions«? (Maybe _not_ »Latest changes«—I’d again assume it would tell me about _program changes_.)

I agree about the icon being scary looking and not helping with clarity here.

I also think that 'Global Changes' is a rather ambiguous name, but I don't think 'Latest Changes' is as ambiguous for most people as you think.  Very few pieces of software embed changelogs , and when they do, it's almost always in some help menu (in the Syncthing UI, I would expect such a link to be in the footer, not grouped with the device entries).  I think perhaps 'Recent Changes' might be a bit better (for me at least, 'recent' tends to have a more spatially local connotation than 'latest'), but I don't think using 'actions' as the second word helps at all (and in fact, I'd argue that it makes the button even more mysterious).

issue.title: modified web gui to show' recent changes' and info icon (fixes #4326)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

labels.name: pr-merged
labels.description: Legacy label used in the past for pull requests merged to the main tree

issue.body:
### Purpose

@HaleTom pointed out that the 'Global changes' button is ambiguous and a bit intimidating:
[https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/4326](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/4326)

> 
> I have no idea what this button does, but I'm too scared to press it as:
> 
> - I don't know what it does
> - It may may be irreversible

This commit implements the sugestions of @Ferroin and @Moonbase59 to rename the button and modal heading to 'Recent Changes' and to use an info icon instead of the history icon.

### Testing

No tests should be needed as this is a minor change to a few html files.

### Screenshots

Before (button)
![global-changes-btn](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4805611/32358253-48c16d3e-c00a-11e7-8edc-1d7fb22a6eee.png)

After (button)
![recent-changes-btn](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4805611/32358265-57f3630c-c00a-11e7-8a99-ced3450650af.png)

Before (modal)
![global-changes-modal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4805611/32358271-61f34aac-c00a-11e7-9b16-d2bb738e0ef3.png)

After (modal)
![recent-changes-modal](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4805611/32358282-6b33966c-c00a-11e7-980d-02689ebf984e.png)

### Documentation

I believe there was some complaint in the issue that there was no reference to this button in the docs. It appears to display the 25 most recent changes to the filesystem. If this hasn't already been covered, it may need to be done. If it has, the docs should refer to the new name on the next update. 

Though having used it on my machine, the button already feel more self-explanatory. Docs might be overkill.

### Authorship
If you are so kind as to add me to the authors section, please use Taylor Khan as my name.

body: Just submitted a pull request that fixes this issue, at least in the browser. Let me know if it's sufficient!

rename.from: "Global Changes" button is confusing. Retitle to "Show Change Log"?
rename.to: "Global Changes" button is confusing, retitle to "Recent Changes"
